item.title: mim add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "Some books leave us free and some books make us free." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: mim add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "Only in books do we learn whatâ€™s really going on." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: mim add a quote by Melanie Joy
item.description: "Becoming aware of the intense suffering of billions of animals, and of our own participation in that suffering, can bring up painful emotions: sorrow and grief for the animals; anger at the injustice and deception of the system; despair at the enormity of the problem; fear that trusted authorities and institutions are, in fact, untrustworthy; and guilt for having contributed to the problem. Bearing witness means choosing to suffer. Indeed, empathy is literally 'feeling with.' Choosing to suffer is particularly difficult in a culture that is addicted to comfort--a culture that teaches that pain should be avoided whenever possible and that ignorance is bliss. We can reduce our resistance to witnessing by valuing authenticity over personal pleasure, and integration over ignorance." -- Melanie Joy

item.title: mim add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Unless someone like you cares a whole awful lot, Nothing is going to get better. It's not." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: mim add a quote by Zoe Weil
item.description: "Someday, I hope that we will all be patriots of our planet and not just of our respective nations." -- Zoe Weil

item.title: mim add a quote by Howard Zinn
item.description: "Small acts, when multiplied by millions of people, can change the world." -- Howard Zinn
